title: infiniteharvest
author: infiniteharvest
content: The Ministry of Education in El Salvador is set to integrate Bitcoin education into the national public school curriculum by the year 2024.Full article: https://medium.com/supreme-crypto-news/el-salvador-to-teach-bitcoin-in-schools-by-2024-674bd0a19bd3I think this should be taught in every school globally along with other investments.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: There is already an existing thread that contains all that relates to El Salvador Bitcoin adoption and also which covers other topics including the El Salvador diploma in Bitcoin which has also gained a lot of attention and generated a lot of discussions in that field.Check the thread and lock this one to avoid these duplicate threadsHere: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5342087.0

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: I would love for children to be taught about economics or the decentralized economy, but a class on Bitcoin for children would be a little complicated. It may be suitable for those at the university level with more technical details for students in colleges of computer and information technology, or for the teaching to be separate classes depending on the school age.We hope that the teaching experience will be better than the adoption experience and will be far from suggestions like Chivo Wallet.Locking the topic would be better since there is a collection El Salvador Bitcoin adoption topics in one place.

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Quote from: Yamane_Keto on October 06, 2023, 07:26:23 AMI would love for children to be taught about economics or the decentralized economy, but a class on Bitcoin for children would be a little complicated.If learning about bitcoin is complicated, then learning generally is complicated.  As for me, there is nothing heard or complex or complicated about learning about bitcoin. The students will be taught the elementary part of bitcoin which is not going to be hard at all. Quote from: Yamane_Keto on October 06, 2023, 07:26:23 AMIt may be suitable for those at the university level with more technical details for students in colleges of computer and information technology, or for the teaching to be separate classes depending on the school age.We hope that the teaching experience will be better than the adoption experience and will be far from suggestions like Chivo Wallet.It is the elementary part that pupils can understand that would be taught according to their level in a way the pupils can understand. It is a good idea by El Salvadoran government.

comments.author: Fuso.hp
comments.body: I heard news a long time ago that El Salvador will add Bitcoin to textbooks, but now I know that it will be implemented from 2024. The people of El Salvador will now know about Bitcoin from childhood. The people of El Salvador will see Bitcoin as a part of education just as we used to understand math, physics, chemistry, etc. by education. El Salvador's government is linking education to Bitcoin where other countries are deciding to manage their education systems differently.  It is a very good aspect for El Salvador if they can control this issue properly. As a result of this move people of their country will get education as well as know a lot about Bitcoin which will help them to eliminate unemployment.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: It’s fascinating to see the development & prosperity that El Salvador is achieving. Adopting a Bitcoin Standard has done wonders for their country. It will take a while but they are doing so well. Bukele is a pioneer, he will save so many people from poverty. The murder rate which was pretty high there has plummeted. He is a living legend, the people owe him so much, he is totally changing the future of the country for the better.

comments.author: RockBell
comments.body: Quote from: infiniteharvest on October 06, 2023, 12:02:12 AMThe Ministry of Education in El Salvador is set to integrate Bitcoin education into the national public school curriculum by the year 2024.Full article: https://medium.com/supreme-crypto-news/el-salvador-to-teach-bitcoin-in-schools-by-2024-674bd0a19bd3I think this should be taught in every school globally along with other investments.The global community has been greatly influenced by El Salvador when it comes to bicoin, making a record for being one of the earliest countries to make Bitcoin legal tender. Currently, they are working with Mi Primer Bitcoin (MPB), and they have an upcoming event where they will be incorporating Bitcoin into the public school curriculum posted on their official page. With everything they are doing, El Salvador is gaining recognition, and other nations will soon follow suit and adhere to the technology. and I like the idea Mi Primer Bitcoin (MPB) is coming up with training 150 teachers and after the training, they can go to their respective schools it has been fully introduced, and in places like Africa the government is not showing much concern for bitcoin. However, I know with time people with knowledge of Bitcoin will become very useful to the government because if they see other governments keying in fully they will not have a choice.

comments.author: lombok
comments.body: This is a great step regarding Bitcoin education. So that students who understand can educate their family and closest relatives. There are many fraudulent investments in the name of bitcoin and blockchain, this kind of thing will definitely appear a lot at a time when the El Salvador government is intensively introducing and adopting Bitcoin in its territory. By intensively providing appropriate education to school students and the community, hopefully it can prevent fraud under the guise of Bitcoin investment in the country.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: infiniteharvest on October 06, 2023, 12:02:12 AMThe Ministry of Education in El Salvador is set to integrate Bitcoin education into the national public school curriculum by the year 2024.This is better education to me, more of the really important and beneficial things and less of the bullshit and outdated curriculum.   Quote from: Oshosondy on October 06, 2023, 09:22:18 AMQuote from: Yamane_Keto on October 06, 2023, 07:26:23 AMI would love for children to be taught about economics or the decentralized economy, but a class on Bitcoin for children would be a little complicated.If learning about bitcoin is complicated, then learning generally is complicated.  As for me, there is nothing heard or complex or complicated about learning about bitcoin. The students will be taught the elementary part of bitcoin which is not going to be hard at all. Exactly, If bitcoin is being taught in schools, learning will be spread over a long period of time, the kids will not need to learn everything at once. It will be introduced to them according to a curriculum in bits, and they will be able to comprehend.Quote from: Ojima-ojo on October 06, 2023, 12:35:23 AMThere is already an existing thread that contains all that relates to El Salvador Bitcoin adoptionThat thread has become a mega thread, many spams there and some users like myself may not be interested in contributing to discussions in such threads. This discussion will also get lost there. The other thread should even be locked.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: El Salvador should really be promoting Bitcoin to all of its citizens and in looking into the future including youngsters can be a good idea and a good, big investment for the country by its government which is a big fan and enthusiast for Bitcoin. I for one is looking forward this to also happen in my country, maybe at the right time. I believe that Bitcoin, the blockchain, cryptocurrency including AI will be a big part of the future and so educating people about these things is something I do appreciate.
